title: Bug report ...... PAGE NOT FOUND broken link

labels.name: bug üêõ
labels.description: Something isn't working

labels.name: good first issue
labels.description: Good item to try if you're new to contributing

labels.name: hacktoberfest
labels.description: Track hacktoberfest activity

labels.name: hacktoberfest-beginner
labels.description: GFI for hacktoberfest participants

body:
### Describe the bug

When visiting the SUMBIT tutorials page via the button located here >>> https://ethereum.org/en/developers/tutorials/ you are presented with pop up that asks if you would like to make a PR but when clicking on the YES button inside the pop up this in fact just redirects you to a broken Github link !!! 

### To reproduce

1. Go to 'https://ethereum.org/en/developers/tutorials/'
2. Click on 'SUBMIT A TUTORIAL' button
3. You are presented with a Pop up containing a button named 'Create a Pull Request'
4. When clicking upon this you are forwarded to https://github.com/ethereum/ethereum-org-website/new/dev/src/content/developers/tutorials
5. SEE ERROR =  Seem theres a broken link displaying default github 404 error page 

### Expected behavior

The page displayed in the browser should be https://github.com/ethereum/ethereum-org-website/pulls thus allowing you to submit a pull request

### Screenshots


![Screenshot_28-9-2024_145857_ethereum org](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/60f6688f-8dfb-493c-8f40-0ef42462832d)
![Screenshot_28-9-2024_145612_github com](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/80b676be-8c35-4970-8c96-6400a26ddbc2)



### Desktop (please complete the following information)

OS =WIN 10 Home 
Browser = MS EDGE Version 128.0.2739.79 (Official build) (64-bit)

### Smartphone (please complete the following information)

OS = Google Pixel 9 
Browser = Chrome 

### Additional context

_No response_

### Would you like to work on this issue?

- [X] Yes
- [ ] No

title: Remove Atom Editor from IDE List on Ethereum.org

labels.name: bug üêõ
labels.description: Something isn't working

labels.name: good first issue
labels.description: Good item to try if you're new to contributing

labels.name: hacktoberfest
labels.description: Track hacktoberfest activity

labels.name: hacktoberfest-beginner
labels.description: GFI for hacktoberfest participants

body:
### Describe the bug

The Atom editor is currently listed as one of the desktop IDEs for Ethereum development on the [Ethereum.org developers page](https://ethereum.org/en/developers/docs/ides/#desktop-ides). However, Atom has officially been sunset as of December 15, 2022, and is no longer being actively maintained by its developers.



### To reproduce

1. Go to the [Ethereum.org developers page for IDEs](https://ethereum.org/en/developers/docs/ides).
2. Scroll down to the "Desktop IDEs" section.
3. Observe that Atom is still listed as a recommended IDE.


### Expected behavior

The Atom editor should be removed from the list of recommended desktop IDEs, as it is no longer supported or maintained.

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Desktop (please complete the following information)

_No response_

### Smartphone (please complete the following information)

_No response_

### Additional context

The sunset announcement can be found in the official [GitHub blog post](https://github.blog/news-insights/product-news/sunsetting-atom/).

### Would you like to work on this issue?

- [X] Yes
- [ ] No

title: Design request: redesign dapps page

labels.name: help wanted
labels.description: Extra attention is needed or someone is needed to help

labels.name: good first issue
labels.description: Good item to try if you're new to contributing

labels.name: ui design üíÖ
labels.description: This issue needs UI design

labels.name: ux design üî¨
labels.description: This issue needs UX design

labels.name: design
labels.description: All the issues related to design should use this tag

body:
This is a design request for anyone to redesign our https://ethereum.org/en/dapps . Ideally, take a holistic approach, remove excessive info and freshen up the UI.

It has been a long time since this page has been updated and the ecosystem has evolved since.

- The mobile design is not well optimized currently hindering the mobile UX
- The content is too large in its scope for one page (the focus should be on doing, less learning)
- Must follow design system - https://www.figma.com/community/file/1134414495420383395

We are looking for fresh takes and ideas for this page, this issue is a call for design exploration and ideation in figma

title: Suggest a wallet: Ctrl Wallet (fka XDEFI Wallet)

labels.name: help wanted
labels.description: Extra attention is needed or someone is needed to help

labels.name: Status: Stale
labels.description: This issue is stale because it has been open 30 days with no activity.

labels.name: good first issue
labels.description: Good item to try if you're new to contributing

labels.name: wallet üëõ
labels.description: This issue relates to adding or changing a wallet

labels.name: product üß∞
labels.description: This involves a product listing

labels.name: awaiting PR
labels.description: Issue is ready for a pull request

body:
### Wallet name

Ctrl Wallet

### What type of wallet?

EOA

### Wallet description

One wallet for all your assets. Multichain wallet that displays all assets and NFTs on 200+ networks. 



### Wallet logo

![App Icon Black](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d3e0733c-6ce6-45ea-a70c-ad393e75ee83)


### Background color for brand logo

#FFFFFF

### URL to the project

https://ctrl.xyz/

### When did the wallet go live to users?

XDEFI has been live since 2020, Ctrl rebrand will be live in September 2024

### What are the fees users may be paying for using your wallet product?

No fees on general usage or transactions. 
0.3% fee on in-app swaps & bridges, with discounts for token holders.

### Does the wallet have an active development team?

Yes. https://github.com/XDeFi-tech/ctrl-extension/

### Is the wallet globally accessible?

Globally accessible everywhere crypto is legal.

### Is the wallet available in multiple languages?

Currently available in English with more languages coming soon.

### What social links are there for the project?

https://discord.gg/ctrlwallet
https://x.com/ctrl_wallet
https://t.me/ctrl_wallet

### Does the wallet have a mobile app? If yes, which operating systems are supported (iOS, Android)?

Yes, iOS & Android

### Does the wallet have a desktop app? If yes, which operating systems are supported (Windows, Mac, Linux)?

N/A

### Does the wallet have a browser extension? If yes, which browsers are supported (Chromium, Firefox, Safari)?

Yes, Chromium

### Is it a hardware wallet?

No

### What is the availability of your source code?

Open source

### What license is the wallet software released under?

This project is licensed under the Apache-2.0 License.

### Who holds the private keys?

Ctrl is a self-custody wallet, we never have access to users private keys. Users have full control over their keys.

### Please describe the measures taken to ensure the wallet's security and provide documentation wherever possible

Security audit by FYEO currently underway.
Previously [audited by Kudelski Security](https://www.xdefi.io/wp-content/uploads/2021/07/XDEFI_Audit_Report_Kudelski.pdf).

### Has the wallet's smart contract code or security modules been audited?

https://www.xdefi.io/wp-content/uploads/2021/07/XDEFI_Audit_Report_Kudelski.pdf

### Does the wallet have an internal security team?

No

### Any other security testing that should be noted?

N/A

### Scam protection?

Yes, integrations with a number of third party security providers, covering:
- Malicious domain detection and warning
- Malicious address scanning
- Transaction simulation
- Transaction and message signing risk analysis

### Does the wallet support connecting to Ethereum applications?

Extension: connect wallet to dapp directly, Mobile: WalletConnect

### Does the wallet support connecting to a hardware wallet?

Yes

### Does the wallet support importing Ethereum RPC endpoints?

Yes

### Does the wallet support viewing and interacting with NFTs?

Yes

### Does the wallet support staking directly?

No

### Does the wallet support swaps directly?

Yes: https://docs.xdefi.io/docs/general/routing

### Does the wallet support bridging directly?

Yes: https://docs.xdefi.io/docs/general/routing

### Does the wallet support multi-chain networks?

Yes. 36 chains natively + hundreds more possible to add by the user. https://docs.xdefi.io/docs

### Does the wallet support Ethereum layer 2 networks?

Yes: https://docs.xdefi.io/docs

### Does the wallet allow the user to customize gas fees?

Yes: 

### Does the wallet support sending transactions to ENS addresses?

Yes

### Does the wallet support importing or automatically querying and displaying ERC-20 tokens?

Yes

### Does the wallet support EIP-1559 (type 2) transactions?

Yes

### Does the wallet have any recovery options?

Recovery via:
- Recovery Phrase
- Private Key
- Hardware Wallet import
- Social Log Ins (web3auth)
- JSON back up

### Does the wallet have fiat on-ramps through credit/debit cards, wire transfers, or bank transfers (ACH)?

Yes

### Does the wallet support withdrawals to fiat?

Yes

### Is the wallet a multi-signature wallet?

No

### Does the wallet support social recovery?

Yes: web3auth integrated

### Does the wallet support bundled transactions?

No

### Who can the ethereum.org team can contact regarding the wallet in future?

https://discord.gg/ctrlwallet
https://x.com/ctrl_wallet
https://t.me/ctrl_wallet

### Does the wallet have a dedicated support team?

Yes, support available via discord or intercom on the website.
Dedicated support team available almost 24/7 with very fast response (less than 30 mins)

### What educational resources/documentation do you provide to users?

User support: https://intercom.help/ctrlwallet/en/
Developer support: https://docs.xdefi.io/docs


### Does the wallet have any integrated tools not mentioned above?

_No response_

### Would you like to work on this issue?

- [ ] Yes
- [ ] No

body: ### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe. Our markdown page template includes "edit" button leading users to github to edit the content. Currently we do not track how many people click on this. We would like to have more information about this component. See examples where this button is: https://ethereum.org/en/guides/ https://ethereum.org/en/guides/how-to-create-an-ethereum-account/ https://ethereum.org/en/web3/ https://ethereum.org/en/developers/docs/ This is how the button looks like: ### Describe the solution you'd like Implement custom event tracking code: Event Category edit_page Event Action gh_edit_click Event Name {page url} ### Describe alternatives you've considered NA ### Additional context _No response_ ### Would you like to work on this issue? - [ ] Yes - [X] No

title: Add JSON-RPC endpoint playground links

labels.name: feature ‚ú®
labels.description: This is enhancing something existing or creating something new

labels.name: help wanted
labels.description: Extra attention is needed or someone is needed to help

labels.name: Status: Stale
labels.description: This issue is stale because it has been open 30 days with no activity.

labels.name: good first issue
labels.description: Good item to try if you're new to contributing

body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

https://ethereum.org/en/developers/docs/apis/json-rpc/

Our JSON-RPC page recently added a "playground" link above all the endpoints (<https://ethereum-json-rpc.com/>)...  But, while a user is scrolling through or reading about a specific endpoint, there is no convenient way to jump to this playground to try out the endpoint.

### Describe the solution you'd like

Proposing we add a link to each endpoint that takes user straight to that endpoint in the playground... ie: `eth_accounts`... <https://ethereum.org/en/developers/docs/apis/json-rpc/#eth_accounts> could have a link such as `[Try this endpoint](https://ethereum-json-rpc.com/?method=eth_accounts)`

### Describe alternatives you've considered

- Build out our own playground (high effort, lower impact given alternative)
- Don't do anything (limits UX by lacking convenient ways to try out an endpoint)

### Additional context

_No response_

### Would you like to work on this issue?

- [ ] Yes
- [X] No
